snippet: I remember being left in the dark to “cry it out” by a father who abandoned me in every way. So how can I leave my baby daughter to face the night alone, even if I probably should?
abstract: I remember being left in the dark to “cry it out” by a father who abandoned me in every way. So how can I leave my baby daughter to face the night alone, even if I probably should?
lead_paragraph: I’m sure he thought he was doing the right thing. Father knows best and all that. Or at least better than his 3-year-old son. And his 3-year-old son was afraid of the dark and had to get over it.

headline.main: My Father Didn’t ‘Know Best.’ How Will I?
